finding.title: Evolution of Swarm Robotics Systems with Novelty Search
finding.description: Novelty search is a recent artificial evolution technique that challenges traditional evolutionary approaches. In novelty search, solutions are rewarded based on their novelty, rather than their quality with respect to a predefined objective. The lack of a predefined objective precludes premature convergence caused by a deceptive fitness function. In this paper, we apply novelty search combined with NEAT to the evolution of neural controllers for homogeneous swarms of robots. Our empirical study
finding.implementationSuggestion: Explore swarm coordination patterns for multi-agent systems
